rdf:Description.dc:title: Morrison Collection of Chinese Books
rdf:Description.dc:description: This collection comprises the Chinese books accumulated by Dr. Robert Morrison (1782 - 1834), the first Protestant missionary to China, during his sixteen years residence in Guangzhou and Macao between 1807 and 1823. Ten thousand Chinese-style thread-bound volumes cover a broad spectrum of subjects from early and mid-Qing China.
rdf:Description.cld:agentName: School of Oriental and African Studies

rdf:Description.cld:accessControl: A Library Guide to Membership is found at: http://www.soas.ac.uk/Library/Guides/membership.html
rdf:Description.cld:note: London Missionary Society held collection from 1825-1834, then UCL until 1922. Six "missing" books held at Bodleian library
